intro: Orthocarpus cuspidatus subsp. cryptanthus, commonly known as the cryptanthus orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in the Andean regions of Peru and Bolivia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic foliage. The subspecies is distinguished by its compact growth habit and distinctive, often reddish or purple-colored flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
